meta.title: Install ML/I on Apple Silicon from LOWL Source
meta.author: Jing Huang

unit.heading: Background
unit.paragraph: ML/I is a general purpose macro processor, which is good at processing any kind of text. There is an Intel Mac implementation available on the official website, and I guess the C-map process will also work on my Silicon machine, but it might not be as efficient as an LOWL-map could be.
Fortunately there is a https://github.com/glguida/ml1-llvm available, so that we can install an assembled one rather than the compiled one.

unit.heading: Get LLVM Installed
unit.paragraph: ml1-llvm requires LLVM to be installed on your system, as it utilizes llc, opt and llvm-as. To build LLVM without other subprojects, these commands will do:
unit.verbatim: git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project.git cd llvm-project cmake -S llvm -B build -G "Unix Makefiles" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release cd build sudo make install -j
unit.paragraph: You can also build a standalone version, so that you don't have to install LLVM on your system.

unit.heading: Make ML/I
unit.paragraph: Fetch the LOWL sources and extract ml1ajb.lwl:
Then clone the ml1-llvm and make the executable.
unit.verbatim: git clone git@github.com:glguida/ml1-llvm.git cd ml1-llvm make ML1SRC=../lowlml1/ml1ajb.lwl sudo install -s -m 755 ml1 /usr/local/bin/ml1
